title: How Is My Mental Health? Burnout Risk Assessment
description: Seven out of ten office workers experience burnout! Are you okay? Read the signals from your body and mind, and prevent it in advance. Take this test to check your current burnout risk level!

questions.text: When you open your eyes on Monday morning as a new week begins, what's your first thought?

options.text: Another fresh day! I prepare myself thinking about what to do
The weekend went by so fast, which is sad, but I get up
Getting ready for work feels heavy and I have no energy
Starting the day itself feels exhausting

questions.text: How well can you maintain concentration during work?

options.text: I often get so focused that I lose track of time!
Usually fine, but sometimes I drift into other thoughts
I often zone out and it's hard to concentrate
Work doesn't catch my attention, and I have no motivation

questions.text: What's your energy level after leaving work?

options.text: I have energy to enjoy leisure activities and time with friends
I'm somewhat tired, but I can go out if I have plans
I feel a lot of fatigue and feel I need personal time
Extreme fatigue - I don't feel recovered even with enough rest

questions.text: How is your sleep quality recently?

options.text: I sleep soundly and wake up refreshed!
I toss and turn sometimes, but overall it's okay
I wake up frequently, and it's hard to fall asleep with work on my mind
Chronic insomnia... I'm tired but can't sleep

questions.text: How do you feel about the work you're currently doing?

options.text: I find it meaningful and fulfilling
I do it calmly without any particular emotion
I sometimes doubt it, but I keep going
It's hard to find meaning in my work and my motivation has dropped a lot

questions.text: How are your relationships with colleagues and supervisors at work?

options.text: We cooperate and maintain positive relationships
We maintain an appropriate distance as work-related relationships
Relationship stress exists and it feels burdensome
I feel isolated or like there's no one to share my feelings with
Healthy and full of energy!
Normal. Sometimes tired, but within normal range
I often have headaches or indigestion
Chronic fatigue and various symptoms persist...

questions.text: How much personal time are you securing?

options.text: I'm investing enough time in hobbies and rest!
I'm busy, but I find my own time here and there
Almost none... I'm buried in work
What hobby? I don't remember

questions.text: How satisfied are you with your achievements and recognition?

options.text: I'm sufficiently recognized and satisfied!
I could receive more, but it's fine
I get so little recognition compared to my effort - it's frustrating
No matter what I do, it's not noticed... I feel hollow

questions.text: Do you think about work even outside of work hours?

options.text: Almost never! I can completely switch off!
It sometimes comes to mind, but I quickly forget
I often think about it and it bothers me
It never leaves my mind...
I'm managing stress well through exercise and hobbies!
I blow off steam sometimes, but not always
It's hard to find ways to relieve stress
I have no relief besides eating or sleeping

questions.text: What are your thoughts about the future?

options.text: I have goals and feel like I'm growing!
I'll live day by day for now and look for opportunities
It feels hopeless... The future feels uncertain
It looks hopeless...

results.title: Burnout-Free Zone! Mental Health Honor Student
results.description: Congratulations! You're currently maintaining a healthy mental state! You're balancing work and life well, and managing stress effectively. Keep this good state going, and give yourself small rewards from time to time. Your positive energy is also making a good impact on those around you!

results.title: Caution Zone! A Little Tired You
results.description: You seem a bit exhausted. It's still okay, but stress signals are starting to show. Now is an important time! It would be good to rest moderately without overexerting yourself and take time to recharge. Try to consciously secure time for exercise, hobbies, and time with people you like. If you manage now, you can successfully prevent burnout!

results.title: Time for Recovery, It's Time to Care for Yourself
results.description: Your body and mind are telling you they need rest. This is also a signal of how hard you've worked so far. Now, securing time for yourself is the most important thing. Start with small changes like a short break, adjusting your workload, or talking to someone you can trust. Your courage to take the first step toward recovery is a sign that you can definitely get back on your feet!

results.title: You Are Not Alone, We Can Solve This Together
results.description: You're going through a tough time right now, aren't you? First, let me give you a round of applause for your courage in honestly checking your condition like this. The feelings you're experiencing are completely understandable and natural reactions. In times like this, seeking help from a professional is the most effective approach. Consult with a psychotherapist, an EAP program, or a psychiatrist. Asking for help is not a weakness, but a wise choice of self-love. You can get better, and there are professionals ready to support you on that journey.
